events.1459: Sun City India founded by Rao in Jodhpur.
events.1666: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj meet Aurangzeb and  was arrested.
events.1906: Gandhiji support the "Home Rule" for India  in the name of ''justice and for good of humanity".
events.1915: Rash Behari Bose, revolutionary leader, left India by boarding a Japanese steamer ''Sanuki Maru'' under assumed name of P. N. Tagore to dodge the British forces.
events.1923: Meera Mukherjee, great artist, was born.
events.1930: R. H. Tahiliyani, former Navy Chief of India Admiral, was born.
events.1949: S Vijaya Laxmi Pandit, first woman foreign ambassador, was received in US.
events.1952: Washington welcomes its first female ambassador, India's Shrimati Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit.
events.1955: The PM laid the foundation stone for the National Museum.
events.1966: Sardar Sikandar Hayat, President of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, resigns.
events.1984: Dr. Rajah Sir Muthiah Chettiar, social reformer, passed away at Madras.
events.1987: Britain's HMS Hermes becomes Indian Navy's second aircraft carrier named INS Viraat.
events.1992: Security scandal, RBI extends probe to four foreign banks.
events.1993: Samsher Bahadur Singh, modern Hindi poet, passed away.
events.1995: Supreme court stays Tamil Nadu Governor's orders allowing Dr. Subramaniam Swamy to prosecute Chief Minister Dr. Jayalalitha under Prevention of Corruption Act.
events.1997: Prime Ministers of India and Pakistan agree to set up joint working groups on a range of issues to be identified by Foreign Secretaries.
events.1998: Bill Clinton, US President, asks India to sign the CTBT.
events.1999: Arunachal Pradesh Governor refuses to quit.
